sense.def: Illness Sign identical with she jiang 舌強 , tongue stiffness. Tai ping sheng hui fang 太平聖惠方 19: 治卒中風不 語，舌根強硬，宜服此方 , 陳醬（五合，三年者妙），人乳汁（五合）。 右件藥，相和研，以生布絞取汁，不計時候，少少與服。良久當語 , “To cure sudden wind stroke with loss of speech and a stiff and hard tongue base it is advisable to ingest the following recipe. Seasoned bean sauce (5 ge , those of 3 years are best), human milk (5 ge ). Grind these two drugs together, and wring them through a fresh piece of cloth to obtain the juice. Give [the patient] a very small amount to ingest, regardless what time it is. After a rather long time he will regain his speech”. She gong 射工 , archer [61]

① Alternative Names duan hu 短狐 , short[-tail] fox; shui nu 水弩 , water crossbow; bao qiang 抱槍 , rifle holder. EA. A small bug in ancient times believed to live in waters and be capable of “shooting” poison from its mouth at people, thereby causing disease. Zhou hou bei ji fang 肘後備急方 7: 江南有射工毒蟲 , “ In the region south of the Yangzi there is a poisonous bug, the ‘ archer ’”.

② Pathological Condition caused by the poison of the archer. Zhou hou bei ji fang 肘後備急方 8: 扁鵲陷水丸，療內脹病，並 蠱疰中惡等，及蜂百毒、溪毒、射工 , “Bian Que’s pills for immersion in water cure diseases of inner distension, and gu -attachment-illness as well as being struck by the malign. Also, [it eliminates] the hundred poisons of wasps, rivulet poison, and archers ”.
